description.b: This tutorial guides you through the creation of an analysis of the content of a set of columns.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata.
item.description: This step opens the analysis creation wizard. It can be open with a right click on the "Analysis" folder or on a column. This wizard helps you to fill the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description....) and then opens an editor in which the settings of the analysis can be filled in.

item.title: Select the columns to analyze.
item.description: Choose the columns that you want to analyze. If you know the content of a column, set its type to either "Nominal", or "Interval". "Nominal" means that the column contains textual values (no order, no mathematical function applicable). On the other hand, "Interval" means that mathematical functions (such as the average) can be used. This type is to be set in the editor. This window is open when clicking on the "Add columns" button .

item.title: Choose the indicators to compute.
item.description: For each column, a set of indicators can be selected. These are the indicators to be computed. This window is open when clicking on the "Add indicators" button for a column.

item.title: Set the parameters of the indicators.
item.description: Indicators may need some parameters. You can set these parameters by clicking the "options" button for each indicator. By default, reasonable parameters are chosen.

item.title: Filter data to analyze.
item.description: Now it's time to set some filters on the data that you want to analyze. This step is optional. By default, all the data are analyzed. Filters can be written by hand.

item.title: Analyze.
item.description: The analysis can now be executed. Just click on the "run analysis" button.
